programmes.show_description: NHK World-Japan's flagship hourly news programme delivers the latest world news, business and weather with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.

The Japanese government has issued a large amount of bonds - with factors such as rising interest rates, it has entered a new phase. We take a closer look at the challenges of Japan's bond issue team.
NHK World-Japan's flagship hourly news programme delivers the latest world news, business and weather with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.
We follow the demolition of a Kumamoto Castle tower damaged by a major earthquake - built 400 years ago by fierce feudal lord Kato Kiyomasa, its secrets are revealed through demolition.
Hop on from Narita - the air gateway to Japan - as breathtaking window views await flying above active volcanoes!
NHK World-Japan's flagship hourly news programme delivers the latest world news, business and weather with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.
Join May J. for great Japanese music! This time, angela - a duo popular for anime songs - and SKE48, a Nagoya-based sister group of AKB48, stop by the studio to chat and perform.
Tohoku: Animation series about a Japanese dog who meets and is helped by many mythical creatures of northern Japan as he searches for eight star talismans. (S1, E08)
End-of-life planning is spreading in Japan - some people are planning ahead and choosing low-cost shared graves over family graves, and some cities are offering end-of-life planning support.

Sanagijima Island is home to lots of free-roaming cats - Kuji rests on some cool shrine steps as other cats hang out close to the sea carefully making their way along a seawall... what are they doing?
NHK World-Japan's flagship hourly news programme delivers the latest world news, business and weather with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.
We meet people in Kumamoto who cherish their ancestry and nature such as a traditional inlay artisan, a group passing on the history of the building of an embankment, and a brown cattle breeder.

Puppet action show for children. In a distant post-human future where surviving creatures have formed a community, new-breed dinosaur girl Rockie sets out on hilarious adventures with her schoolmates.
After having an accident one day, Mee wondered, 'Maybe I don't need underpants?' Through interviews with passers-by and a wild imagination, Mee searches for reasons to wear underpants.
NHK World-Japan's flagship hourly news programme delivers the latest world news, business and weather with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.

Matera in southern Italy is a town carved into pale limestone cliffs - with its rows of cave dwellings, this city has been home to people for thousands of years and is now a UNESCO World Heritage Site
NHK World-Japan's flagship hourly news programme delivers the latest world news, business and weather with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.
Enjoy a beloved local ramen from the snowy north, a steaming hot bowl that warms body and soul in the bitter cold!
Tsubo-niwa - life enhanced by quintessential spaces. Dive deep into the beauty of the ancient capital which is still innovative 1,200 years after its foundation.
This time: making suggestions. Marianne from the Philippines has worked for two years as a housekeeper; her company want her service to go to the next level by learning how to make recommendations.
Maro Kuratani knits scarves and other items with surplus yarn, using threads of varying colour and thickness. She says yarn is the ultimate eco-friendly material as reknitting is always an option.

How can farming in Japan be made more exciting? That question drives a farmer from Indonesia who sees potential to help his community via agriculture.

programmes.show_name: Why is Hay Fever Getting Worse?
programmes.show_description: The number of people suffering from hay fever, which seriously impacts daily life, is increasing worldwide - behind this trend is a change in pollen dispersal patterns influenced by climate change.
Yamagata / Nakui Naoko (Book Designer): Thread for traditional 'shina' fabric takes a year to make - ultrafine mohair is also made here with a 60-year-old device. Nakui admires the hunt to improve.
We meet Turkish-born Resat Dedekoc - who hopes to produce wine to enliven the region of Kinasa in Nagano Prefecture - and South Korean Kim Bo-Youn, who runs a ballet school in Tokyo.
NHK World-Japan's flagship hourly news programme delivers the latest world news, business and weather with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.
The Jomon period dates roughly from 13,000 to 300 B.C. - we examine various aspects of Jomon society with footage from time-lapse creator Shimizu Daisuke. This time: the Sannai Maruyama Site.

programmes.show_name: Bosai: Science That Can Save Your Life
programmes.show_description: Be earthquake-ready and learn survival tips for quakes and when you're trapped under rubble - you'll want to watch this before your next trip to Japan!
Learn how to make the most of your Japanese skills - watch our drama that features useful communication strategies, our snappy videos about onomatopoeia, and our documentaries on 'senpai' in Japan.

'Bosai Leaders' promote mutual resident support before and during disasters - these days, foreign participants are playing a significant role. We introduce those being trained in Nakano Ward in Tokyo.
In a special feature on Hokkaido, programmes looked at the ecology of brown bears, a special bento lunch, and a bountiful landscape formed by rugged natural conditions and pioneering development.
NHK World-Japan's flagship hourly news programme delivers the latest world news, business and weather with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.
This programme visits places across Japan to introduce the charms of their local daily life and festivals fostered by the nation's long history.
NHK World-Japan's flagship hourly news programme delivers the latest world news, business and weather with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.
The Darwin team's cameras eye some mysterious trees in the African desert featuring massive dangling bundles of dry grass - these amazing ecosystems reveal their secrets for 720 consecutive hours.

Kamikochi is a beautiful mountainous region in Nagano Prefecture that's 1,500m above sea level - with a reflective pond and rime ice, see the frozen beauty of Kamikochi through time-lapse photography.
NHK World-Japan's flagship hourly news programme delivers the latest world news, business and weather with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.
Children on horseback take part in a 600-year-old tradition in Ehime Prefecture - with fewer participants each year, one strict trainer sees promise in a young rider spurred on by his love of horses.
At the Satoyama Kitchen guesthouse in Hida Takayama, chef Nobuko, her cameraman husband Makoto and their cat Tama take us on a tasty journey of local cuisine served with a side of seasonal scenery.

This programme gives you comprehensive coverage of events in Japan and Asia, explaining the day's developments and what is behind them.
Architect Sejima Kazuyo has won global attention for her delicate style, breaking from the norm to achieve free and open spaces - she explains her architectural philosophy.
Spear squid is immensely popular in squid-loving Japan - tag along with fishers in Hokkaido and savour some regional cuisine, fresh sushi, and a special take on a beloved Italian-inspired inky dish.

Doodles or Ukiyo-e: A series of doodles by famous artist Utagawa Kuniyoshi turn out to be carefully considered depictions of the kabuki actors of the day; what kind of statement was he trying to make?
